_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Facility Name: Gold-Eagle Cooperative

Location: 402 Old Highway 18, Wesley, IA 50483

Contact: Lynn Ostendorf

RMP Facility ID: 1000 0023 9422



RMP Executive Summary below:



1. The Facility Policy: The owners, management and employees of Gold-Eagle Cooperative are committed to the prevention of any accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia by utilization of proper equipment, regular inspections and maintenance, and training of all persons that work with the material. Should an accidental release occur, the facility has coordinated with the local fire department and the local emergency planning committee so they can plan for a response to any release and minimize the impact of the release to the public and the environment.



2. Facility Information: The primary activity at the facility is the storage of anhydrous ammonia for sale to farmers. Anhydrous ammonia is received, stored and distributed for direct application as a crop production nutrient.



3. The worst case release scenario is not listed in the executive summary for security reasons. The alternate case release scenario is not listed in the executive summary for security reasons.



4. The Accidental Release Program: The facility complies with Iowa Administrative Code Part 21, Chapter 43, Rule 43.6(200) relating to the storage and handling of anhydrous ammonia. These regulations administered by the Department of Agriculture are consistent with ANSI/CGA G-2.1 and OSHA 29 CFR 1910.111 regarding the storage and handling of anhydrous ammonia.



5. The Five Year Accident History: There have been no accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia from the covered process in the past five years that have resulted in onsite or offsite deaths, injuries, evacuations, sheltering-in-place, property or environmental damage.



6. The Emergency Response Program: The facility has a written emergency action plan in accordance with OSHA Standard 29 CFR 1910.38 and provides state and local authorities chemical inventory infor

mation as required under SARA Title III of EPCRA. Emergency action plan information is available to the local fire department and emergency planning committee for coordination in the community response plan.



7. Planned Changes to Improve Safety: Safety improvements are on-going at the facility. Periodic audits and reviews are performed to assess the implementation of safe practices and operations. There are no additional specific anhydrous ammonia safety recommendations for implementation at this time.
